div.sent: We see many things with our eyes.
We see a lot of things around us.
We see various living beings, animals and birds.
In the daytime, if we look up, we see the sun and the sky.
At night we see the moon and the stars in the sky.
We know that God created everything in six days with His words only.
Why did God create all these?
He created all these things for the welfare of human being.
He also gave them many other responsibilities too.
These are to look after the creation of God.
In other words, it is to take care of all things that God has created.
We nurture plants that we plunt in the compounds of our houses.
We water them regularly.
We use fertilizer.
We put fence so that no one can spoil them.
As we take care of them, the plants grow and give us flowers and fruits.
We become happy and get benefits from them.
Why should we look after these things?
If we plant a flower plant, it is we who take care of that.
Similarly, God should take care of His own creation.
Why should we take care of His creation?
He has created us after His own image.
We are the representatives of God on the earth.
Who is a Representative?
What do we mean by the word representative?
It means to work on behalf of the master.
The mind set of the representative should be like his master's.
For example, when our parents are busy, they ask for our help.
They ask us to look after their cows, lambs, chicken etc.
We take care of them as our own things.
We do not kill them or sell them.
When one is lost, we look for it.
We keep on finding until we get it back.
As we find it, we take it back home happily.
We do it because we are the representatives of our parents.
Our parents home is our home.
Our parents work is our work.
Similarly, we are the representatives of God.
He has given us the responsibility to look after His creation.
He wants us to look after the animals, birds, trees and plants as our own.
We should protect and take proper care of them.
We should remember that we are God's representatives.
A representative considers the owner's work as his or her own.
What do we mean by taking care of?
We shall serve the members of our family and our neighbours.
We shall not harm anyone.
We shall not kill any animal or harm any bird.
We shall not cut trees and plants.
We shall throw waste at a fixed place, not just here and there.
We shall not throw wastes in the rivers, pools or ponds.
We shall plant new trees every year.
We shall encourage others to plant trees.
We shall take care of everything.
What Happens if We do not Take Care of God's Creation?
We do harm to ourselves by destroying God's creations.
We cannot get shade or fruit from the trees if we cut them off.
We cannot hear the birds song if we kill them.
Birds benefit us by eating insects.
If we kill the birds, they will not be able to come to our help.
Water becomes polluted and germs grow in the water if we throw rubbish into it.
So we cannot use the water.
Many people will become sick and die if they use polluted water.
We disobey God when we do not take care of God's creation.
It is a kind of sin to disobey God.
We are punished for committing sins.
